definition: to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: You've postured until everyone's sick of you.
sentences.chinese: 你装模作样，直到大家都讨厌你。

sentences.english: Smugness, embarrassment and fear can all cause smiles.
sentences.chinese: 装模作样，尴尬和害怕都能使人微笑。

sentences.english: We always felt she was playacting.
sentences.chinese: 我们总觉得她在装模作样。
她是个装模作样的女孩。

sentences.english: I am sometimes accused of being an inveterate poseur .
sentences.chinese: 有时有人说我惯于装模作样。
她那装模作样劲儿真令人作呕。
装模作样劲儿真令人作呕。

sentences.english: When it comes to EU diplomacy Germany does not do histrionics.
sentences.chinese: 在欧盟外交方面德国从不装模作样。

sentences.english: In the hall, an eye then saw the affectation of the priests.
sentences.chinese: 进了会场，皓月一眼便看到了那个装模作样的道士。

sentences.english: In the living room, there were a band of people dancing in group affectedly , which was very farcical.
sentences.chinese: 客厅里一帮人在装模作样地跳集体舞，我觉得很好笑。

sentences.english: The question Is this playacting or does he really hate us?
sentences.chinese: 他到底是装模作样还是真的恨我们？

definition: to make a show of being very much in earnest (idiom)/to act as if one is taking things very seriously
see 煞有介事[sha4 you3 jie4 shi4]
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
not a word or movement (idiom); remaining calm and collected/not batting an eyelid
not in the least concerned (idiom)/reckless/couldn't give a damn about it/unperturbed/couldn't care less/harum scarum
